name: Roseline Delisle
biography: Roseline Delisle attended the Institute of Applied Arts in Montreal, Quebec (1969-73). After graduation, she was employed by Enid LeGros-Wise. In 1978, she moved to the United States and opened a studio in Santa Monica, California, where she remained until her death. Delisle is best known for her large-scale ceramic vessels, first working in fired porcelain, and when unable to produce her ambitious monumental pieces. She exhibited all over California.
